subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... If I hadn t had a disk failure last year, you d be able to see an example or two, but I did, so you can t. ... Agreed. I would rather work to fix the
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > I use Contract Tests (which I used to call Abstract Test Cases, but that
> > old name doesn't reveal intent) to enforce these restrictions. If you
> > implement me, you'd better pass my Contract Tests, or you don't really
> > implement me. If the above example were really important, there'd be
> a test.
>
> That's a good idea, and if I'd ever seen it done in practice I might be
> more willing to accept it. In fact,. I have never once seen an interface
> based API that came with a set of tests implementations were required to
> pass. This includes major APIs shipped by organizations like JavaSoft
> and the W3C, not just internal corporate work and open source hacking.

If I hadn't had a disk failure last year, you'd be able to see an
example or two, but I did, so you can't.

> Of course, I've never looked at your codebase. Given that you do this, I
> suspect your code is likely more robust and reliable than what i see out
> there, which doesn't really surprise me. It's long been known that a
> small percentage of programmers are vastly more productive than most
> programmers are. I suspect the programmers who hang out on mailing
> lists, attend conferences, write and read articles, and so forth tend to
> be in the more productive group. However, these are not the majority of
> working developers, and realistic API design has to work for the
> majority of client programmers, not just the top 10%.

Agreed. I would rather work to fix the programmers. It's the idealist in
me. What if a majority of client programmers knew to look for Contract
Tests?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
